snippet: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. sounded frustrated over an Environmental Protection Agency regulation issued Friday  that addressed the heart of an environmental group’s lawsuit against loggers.
abstract: Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr appears frustrated during Supreme Court argument about whether Clean Water Act applies to runoff from logging roads; much of argument around last-minute action from Environmental Protection Agency, which addresses legal issues before court, is devoted to consequences of new environmental regulation for  two consolidated Oregon cases.
lead_paragraph: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. sounded frustrated over an Environmental Protection Agency regulation issued Friday  that addressed the heart of an environmental group’s lawsuit against loggers.

headline.seo: E.P.A. Rule Complicates Supreme Court Case on Logging Runoff
headline.main: E.P.A. Rule Complicates Runoff Case for Justices
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Rule Complicates Case For Justices
